etymons.meaning: to wrap around; to surround; to wander around; to make a circuit; to rotate around

Preterit Intransitive.turoyo: 1) ḥayawmo m-ay=yawme d-alohohiyeann=arbʕi=greʕayḏenaḥiti w azzehənkarixi b-u=ṭuro d-məskiṣaydo 182; 62/222; zmiroṯo d-Danḥo w l-Pōl, karixiaṯrawoṯeḥDD 393/1; briṯo, i=štaġaliyekarixoebakarixi a=tloṯo=bnoṯ-ani bayn a=greʕune d-i=walaye
translations: ‘The talk was around the people (lit. ‘the world’) RT 11;
‘The three daughters walked among the young men of the city’ 75/204;

Preterit Intransitive.turoyo: 2) karəxlalġulnošo lo=ḥzele 182; prs 43/23; prs 53/36; ayko d-karixisəmmelə=səmmelə=ḥzalle u=ʕazlolo=ṭrelandukṯo d-lo=karixinaaʕle w-lo=ḥzelan
translations: ‘We have left no place where we were not searching for him. And we still have not found him’; 47/52

Preterit Intransitive.turoyo: 3) karəx u=maǧləs d-Abu-Zēd, šġiliʕam Abu-Zēd 183; prs 15/4; 16/4; 35/9; 4) lo=karəxlišoni 183; prs 105/24; u=zoġayḏiməd-kət-we kayiwo, lo=karixoiḏiaʕle d-nŭḥánno-le 11/259;aḥuni me-ṣafroiḏe lo=karixo d-qoṭe-li me-laxalf
translations: ‘My brother since morning did not have the heart to kill me from behind’ 77/50;

Infectum.turoyo: 1) g-korəxʕalaz=zəfkar, ánnaqqa d-sōmmḥayḏ̣ər u=dahwayḏa w mḥayḏ̣ər u=flānbēhvanayḏa 182; 65/140; min ḥzalxu b-u=ʕulmodə-k-kurxituhauxa? ’; 24/15; ya u=wab-ayḏi! k-ubʕenomenox d-ubat-li məqdār d-kallātḥatta d-əzzinokuraxno b-aw=walayat w-d-maṯnaḥno u=kew-anodiḏi, d-gurašnohawa ‘’; 24/47 [MT]; u=naʕimo d-kulle, d-i=čiroke ko-kurxoaʕle, əšmeXangīr-wa
translations: ‘The youngest of all, whom our story is about, his name was

Infectum.turoyo: 2) i=ḥurmayḏi-steaṯyo b-u=šuqo ko-kərxo-la ʕallaḥmo 182; 63/318; kurxiaf=farošeaʕli, tli-li prs 249/8; uno-stezlamfaqiro-no, kuráxno-li ʕalšuġlomede ‘’; 24/159
3) u=məǧləs lo=korəx d-lo mene. kət-le mālġắlabebə-ḥasab 183; prs 20/15; prs 159/35;
4) lo=korəxfemayye d-məšġoli, ṣxīrfemayye 183; prs 32/29; ak=kuhne w u=ʕulmoqaroyo k-qorən l-u=yawm-ano u=mbarx-anoFanṭiqusṭi; bale lišono d-u=ʕulmoʕal u=xabro d-u=Rəššayšṭaw k-korəx 12/18;

Infectum-wa.turoyo: 1) lăšan d-maḥwe i=lašayḏe l-kulnošo, kŭrax-wo b-u=bayto 182; 1/51; 2/98 w kurxí-way-na, kul=ḥamoyad-wa l-i=turayḏe,w kurxí-way-nabayto=bayto 2) ono xōrtnaʕimokoráx-way-no ʕal-aṯe, w ádyawmaaṯyočikobayn al=lapatayḏi 183; 64/160; noše d-ʔəmmi-way-lanxabroəzza-way-na l-ann=aṯrawoṯ-anəkkurxí-way-na, be lə=g-ḥozina-lanqanyono me diḏan
translations: ‘When people let us know, we would go to those places and look around in search of our cattle'

Imperativ.turoyo: 1) ramḥəlbəṯṯər me-fəlge=d-yawmo, nḥatu hat w hiya l-u=bəstono, w hawxakraxkraxto b-gawe d-u=bəstono 182; 81/81; ḥzaybayn-i=walaye, kraxbayn u=ahl diḏox, baynaq=qariwe, kitobnoṯo d-wazireġálabe, kit tuǧǧārġálabe, kit nošezangīnġálabe ‘’; 24/49 2) zəxkraxʕal u=qliḏo d-u=qaydo, ftaḥqaydo me-qḏoli 183; prs 213/2; ṭawwokraxu!

Preterit.turoyo: mawbele l-u=gaboro, makraxle b-u=baḥar 184; prs 115/20; b-u=šəkl-awomakráxxal-li LB 59;makraxxeməštawoṯeDD 393/3; makraxxeqaḥwa

Infectum.turoyo: k-omər “ṭláwḥe-ne. k-mədwori, k-máwrəqi, k-məḥṣodi, k-mitákrəxi, w bəṯṯər g-məgrosi b-i=gurusto k-mitaḥtiʕal i=nuro, k-owənṭlawḥeḥa k-ŭxe-lən” 6/52;

Infectum-wa.turoyo: freḏobə-freḏomakrax-wo l-masbaḥayḏe w b-lebokarubogŭras-wo u=duxonodə-ǧġarayḏe 184; 11/232; gd-oṯən-waaʕ=ʕaṭore, əmmí-way-le ḥaŠēxMaḥmūd, amṭe-wadarmōnkatveǧamakráx-wa-lle, w masamqi-wa ab=beʕeŠēxḥmūd

Part act..turoyo: ḥa k-makrəx w ḥakə-mtawe b-i=segulike bara d-u=makərxono 184; 94/95;
